intro: Elleanthus stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf elleanthus, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming a flat-topped cluster that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Elleanthus stenophyllus is often found in open, sunny habitats and is adapted to dry conditions.
